page.title: 12WILDLIFE ALONG THE CART
page.content: The{Cart Valley}is important for the ecology of the area.There is a {preservation order}on the trees and the survival of farm hedgerows encourages a wide variety of{plants, {animals}and{birds.}The valley at Busby Glen is steep.The rivers course is varied with waterfalls,rapids and calm stretches.Fish such as{trout}are found and birds such as{heron}and{kingfisher have been sighted.{Foxes}are common, often moving into nearby gardens for food.In winter{roe deer}can be found sheltering in the tree covered valley. A recent survey along the Cart revealed over 100 different plants and birds ranging from{sparrowhawks}to {blue tits}were noted. The{Community Council}has done much to draw public attention to the wide variety of wildlife and encourage its protection.
